title: DSAN “Evolution of Data Science” Conference, Poster Session
text:
The following posters will be presented during the poster session on Friday, September 8th from 5:00pm to 6:00pm. Congratulations to all selected authors!
You are expected to be present, with your poster, for the full session from 5:00pm to 6:00pm, in Copley Lounge on Georgetown’s campus. Attendance at the other sessions of the two-day conference is optional, but you are encouraged to attend, as the conference registration fee is waived for accepted poster presenters! We recommend business attire for all sessions.
You can use FedEx’s poster printing services to print the 24”-by-36” posters for the session. You only need to print the posters themsevles—easels for holding the posters will be set up and ready for you to use at the session! For more details see the printing instructions page, or the FAQs page for more general concerns! If anything you need is not covered there, please feel free to email me (Jeff Jacobs) at jj1088@georgetown.edu.







Title
Author(s)




Exploration of the Factors Affecting Salaries and Employment
Wendi Chu and Tingsong Li


Community Prediction with NLP: Text Classification Algorithms Using Reddit Data
Victor De Lima and Matthew Moriarity


DEFIYIELD: Exploitation of Open Blockchain Platforms
Tegveer Ghura


Data Analysis for GAD7 (Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item)
Zeyu Han


The Peltzman Effect in Action: Analyzing the Relationship Between Bike Lane Coverage and Cyclist Safety in New York City
Wanying Li


Unpacking the Factors Influencing Election Outcomes: A Comprehensive Analysis
Mike Liu


Visualizing Success in the NFL: An Analysis of the National Football League
Matthew Moriarity and Alex Pattarini


A Visual Exploration of Walkability in Washington, D.C.
Cynthia Ng and Valeria Vera Lagos


Insights on Factors of World Happiness
Yunhong Yang, Ziyue Li, Yutao Chen, and Xiaodan Lu

title: Poster Printing Instructions
text:
It is recommended, but optional, that you follow the standard narrative structure used by most academic posters.
For example:

Abstract
Background/Introduction
Research Questions
Methodologies
Results
Conclusions/Insights

However, this is just an optional recommendation, feel free to deviate from this structure if you feel you can present the work in a better way.
The following guide, from NYU Libraries, is a good resource on what makes a good research poster: https://guides.nyu.edu/posters

title: Poster Printing Instructions
text:
Poster Printing
For printing the poster, we recommend using the poster printing services offered by FedEx. A 24”-by-36” poster will cost $34.50 using this service.

text:

title: Frequently Asked Questions
section: What portion(s) of the conference are presenters required to attend?
text:
What portion(s) of the conference are presenters required to attend?
You will be expected to be present, with your poster, for the full session from 5:00pm to 6:00pm, in Copley Lounge on Georgetown’s campus. Attendance at the other sessions of the two-day conference is optional, but you are encouraged to attend, as the registration fee is waived for accepted poster presenters!
